name: Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering Technology

Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engine: Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering Technology The Bachelor of Science in Mechanical Engineering Technology is a four-year, career-oriented, and hands-on degree program. Due to its broad nature, the program gives its graduates a variety of career paths, including product design and development, machines and processes, manufacturing, operations, and technical sales.

notes: Rowan Core: 9 s.h. All first-time Freshmen must complete the University Rowan Core Literacies. There are six literacies: Communicative Literacy (COML) - 9 s.h. Satisfied by taking the following three courses: COMP 01111 College Composition I COMP 01112 College Composition II CMS 04205 Public Speaking Note: Engineering Majors will take (11 s.h.) COMP 01111 College Composition I ENGR 01201 Sophomore Engineering Clinic I ENGR 01202 Sophomore Engineering Clinic II Artistic Literacy (ARTL) Global Literacy (GLBL) Humanistic Literacy (HUML) Quantitative Literacy (QNTL) Scientific Literacy (SCIL) Majors may suggest courses to fulfill the above literacies and will be applied elsewhere. A complete listing of courses that fulfill the above literacies can be found here Undergraduate Program Requirements.

Rowan Experience Students must satisfy all three Rowan Experience attributes. Credits attached to the courses in this section will apply elsewhere. The attributes are as follows: Broad-Based Literature Attribute (LIT) Writing Intensive Attribute (WI) Rowan Seminar Attribute*(RS) Departments may recommend courses to fulfill these attributes. A complete listing of courses that satisfy these attributes can be found at Undergraduate Program Requirements. *The Rowan Seminar requirement is waived for all students transferring 24 or more approved credits into Rowan University at the time of initial entry.
Calculus II taken at Community College Credits: 3
Humanistic Literacy - Credits: 3 Artistic Literacy - Credits: 3 Global Literacy - Credits: 3 Business/Economics Elective - Credits 3

Courses taken Prior to Joining Rowan University: 29 s.h. EGR 02.151 - First-Year Technology Clinic I - Credits: 2 EGR 02.152 - First-Year Technology Clinic II  - Credits: 2 EGR 02.251 - Sophomore Technology Clinic I - Credits: 1 EGR 02.252 - Sophomore Technology Clinic II - Credits: 1 MET 07.102 - Engineering Graphics for MET - Credits: 3 MET 07.271 - Statics for MET  - Credits: 3 MET 07.291 - Dynamics for MET - Credits: 3 MET 07.251 - CNC Programing - Credits: 4 MET 07.255 - Matlab Programming for MET - Credits: 3 EET 03.121 - Electrical Circuits I - Credits: 4 EET 03.370 - Control System and Programmable Logic Controllers - Credits: 3
Courses Taken at Rowan University: 47 s.h.
Technical Elective (ME/MET courses at the 300 or 400 level) - Credits: 3 Technical Elective (ME/MET courses at the 300 or 400 level) - Credits: 3

Total Required Credits for the Program: 120 s.h. Note : The current program requirements represent an example transition model between Rowan College of South Jersey (RCSJ) and Rowan University. Students take 60 credits of coursework at RCSJ and 60 credits of coursework at Rowan University. For students transferring from other community colleges to Rowan University to pursue the Mechanical Engineering Technology degree, please consult the program advisor. Program Coordinator/Advisor Contact Information Yashwant Sinha Lecturer & MET Program Advisor Rowan Hall 856.256.5322 sinha@rowan.edu
